reviewText:
There are other dvds, that I like better for toddlers - -than the Spot series...

Better programming is available . . .

Until I find more of the good stuff, I will stick with Raffi, Baby Boost, 25 & 40 year old Winnie the Pooh's, 50 year old Bambi . . . and other certain Disney's . . .

TLN  Golden, Colorado

The BBC Spot movies are a great introduction to TV for young toddlers. They are slow paced, and the stories will be familiar if you've read a lot of Spot books. I especially like the grandparents theme of this DVD, and my toddler loves that they ride a fire truck.
Sweet and innocent characters. My son loooves Spot books and videos and its not too C.G.I. overstimulating to watch before bed/nap.
This DVD has a full length cartoon of Spot and family.  It also has two short stories featuring his grandparents.  They sing cute songs, help friends, and each other.  Great clean family fun.
I showed my son Spot on my old VHS tapes, and he loved it. I bought him 5 different Spot DVD's for his second birthday and he was really happy.

My son is 3 and he loves this video. Not only does he enjoy the main program, but the 2 special features seem so like his grandparents he swers its the dog version of them! He espcially likes the part where Grandma has a vacuum and Spot wants to help. 3 year olds want to help.
My 2  1/2  year old grandson loves this video.  We watch it over and over.  All grandparents will get a kick out of this.
Keeps my 2 year old grandson busy, and that's good by me! I bought this with a plush toy of Spot, and it keeps his attention very nicely!
